pageContext.description: Typology: twist from tang to blade - orig. feature?; flat-sided tang with crisp angles; bl. sides little more irreg. with some facetting of angles - v. slight development of fg. lips in odd places; sl. convex bl. sides outline - orig., Manufacture: small hmks on tang face; large ones on bl. face - creating an arched bev. at top of one face; grmks along bl. e. - anc. as they go under corr. lumps; 'gouged' furrows on bl. sides - anc., Condition: most of e. with minor corr. chip dam.; tang end poss. little dam. - black-brown colour
pageContext.surface: grass-green p., flaking a little at edges to [...] green dry sur.; scattered lumps green and orangey.
pageContext.collection: Worthing Museum 574/3, presented by Mrs. Henty, no apparently by W.R. Butterfield, Hasstings, formerly E. Henty Collection
pageContext.toSearch: Highdown Hill, South Downs National Park, Ferring, Worthing, West Sussex Bn12 6pf, United Kingdom
pageContext.remarks: Context: 7b. Group, Labels/Markings: black ink-printed: 574. white sect. s/o label: 6, PIF: check, AFI: check, DF: C, SI: check, CI: check, Rec.: SR Nov. 78, Source: MV
